page.title: 16Rozel Manor
page.content: Rozel Manor is situated in the heart of St. Martin, and has been the home of{the Lempriere family}since the l4th century. The Manor house was rebuilt in l77O. The land covers 7OO vergees (3ll acres) including cottages, a farm, a chapel and a colombier. {In {feudal times}the seigneur was lord of the Manor tied by feudal rights and dues to the people who lived on his fief and to the monarch. One of his duties was to ride out into the sea on horseback to meet the Monarch. Today when the Queen visits Jersey she is presented to the Bailiff, Lieutenant Governor and then to the seigneurs of Rozel and Trinity. Today the Manor is only of importance to the community as a beautiful building and for charitable events. It is not open to the public. Today the seigneur is Brigadier Lempriere Robin.
